column4: I'm running a server as a main desktop I had a raid running, became annoying and got rid of the majority of hard drives. I took out the raid pci card and now when i boot the server it takes up to 4 minutes to get to the bootloader anyone know a fix?
why use server as a desktop? Makes no sense
only computer right now
buying a new laptop soon
joer1: I'd ask in #kernel or #linux
do i need to uninstall something related to the raid like a driver?
if yuo run:   lspci    then use the identifying line to find guides
joer1: it would if there is a proper vdpau module for your system, you have made your own kernel which we cannot support
ActionParsnip:
00:00.0 Host bridge: Intel Corporation 82945G/GZ/P/PL Memory Controller Hub (rev 02)
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82945G/GZ Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 02)
joer1: then your kernel is compiled weird then
00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation N10/ICH 7 Family High Definition Audio Controller (rev 01)
00:1c.0 PCI bridge: Intel Corporation N10/ICH 7 Family PCI Express Port 1 (rev 01)
1. you only need the ONE line identifying the controller   2. Spamming the channel is not cool
sorry ActionParsnip
joer1: none official kernels are not supported here
joer1: so it is very much a question of your kernel
couldn't see anything in the list, might be setup in an old windows partition
pici: can you educate Joer1 on the policy on none official kernels please
it just comes up with a blinking underscore for 4 minutes goes blank then comes up with the bootloader
joer1: I think you will find, not
anyone know how to install firefox 7 in ubuntu, only way i could get it working was through a shortcut, wasn't in the synaptic manager or software centre
http://nwlinux.com/install-firefox-7-ubuntu-using-apt-get/
